data.title: August 11th 1492: Election of Pope Alexander VI
data.meta_description: On August 11th 1492, Cardinal Rodrigo Borgia was elected Pope, taking the name Alexander VI.
data.text:
Funerary Monument to Pope Callixtus III & Pope Alexander VI

On August 11th 1492, Cardinal Rodrigo Borgia was elected pope, taking the name Alexander VI. He would become one of the most infamous popes in the history of the papacy!

Pope Alexander VI (r. 1492-1503) was the nephew of a former pontiff, namely Callixtus III (r. 1455-58). Both popes are interred in the church of Santa Maria in Monserrato degli Spagnoli.

The funerary monument (first chapel on the right), which wasn't erected until 1889, is the work of the Spanish sculptor Felipe Moratilla Parreto (1827-1908).

See also: The Borgia Apartment.

My name is David Lown and I am an art historian from Cambridge, England. Since 2001 I have lived in Italy, where I run private walking tours of Rome.
